q: DC- In a surprise shakeup, Google co-founder Larry Page is replacing Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the search giant. Starting April 4, Page will take over day-to-day operations while Eric Schmidt becomes executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. Shortly after the announcement was posted on the company's blog, Eric Schmidt tweeted "Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!" in reference to his much-discussed role as a moderating check to Page

INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 27( UPI)-- Republican U.S. Rep. Mike Pence said Thursday he won't run for president in 2012, but he didn't rule out a run for governor of Indiana. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence said of his family in a letter sent to supporters, The Indianapolis Star reported. Messrs. Eric Schmidt , Page and Sergey Brin sought to play down any personality differences on Thursday.
